title: Expand logo showcase to 10 distinct logo style variants

requirements.text: In the Logo Concept Generator tool (the card workspace at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]), replace the existing 4-variant multi-style logo showcase with an expanded 10-variant logo showcase. Render all 10 of the following logo style variants as inline SVG cards using the same brand inputs (brand name, primary color, secondary color, accent color, icon shape, font style): (1) Wordmark — brand name in recommended font, background filled with primary color, no icon; (2) Lettermark — first 1–2 initials as large bold type in a circle using primary and accent colors; (3) Emblem — brand name inside a geometric badge/shield shape with icon symbol, using primary and secondary colors; (4) Icon + Wordmark — geometric icon to the left of brand name text on dark background with gold accent; (5) Monogram — all initials stacked or overlapping in a square frame using primary and secondary colors; (6) Abstract Mark — a purely geometric/abstract SVG shape derived from the icon concept, with brand name as a small caption below, on accent color background; (7) Mascot-Style Badge — brand name inside a circular badge with a simple stylized icon at the top and a tagline placeholder at the bottom, using all brand colors; (8) Stacked Wordmark — brand name split into two lines with an SVG divider line between them, on a dark background with primary color accent; (9) Negative Space Mark — icon shape rendered as a cutout (white shape on primary color background) with brand name below; (10) Gradient Wordmark — brand name text filled with a linear gradient transitioning from primary to secondary color on a dark background. Display all 10 variants in a responsive 2-column grid of inline SVG cards (each approximately 300×180px), each labeled with its style name below the preview. Each card must have a individual download button that exports that specific SVG card as a PNG file.

quotes: it can generate 10 different types of logos

acceptanceCriteria: The logo showcase section at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2] displays exactly 10 distinct logo style variants after generating a logo concept
All 10 variants are rendered as inline SVG elements using the brand name, primary color, secondary color, accent color, icon shape, and font style from the generated concept
Each variant card is labeled with its style name (Wordmark, Lettermark, Emblem, Icon + Wordmark, Monogram, Abstract Mark, Mascot-Style Badge, Stacked Wordmark, Negative Space Mark, Gradient Wordmark)
The 10 cards are displayed in a responsive 2-column grid layout
Each card has its own download button that exports that card's SVG as a PNG file
The implementation uses only basic SVG primitives (rect, circle, polygon, text, line, linearGradient) without external dependencies
No performance or build issues are introduced by the expanded implementation

constraints: Only modify the logo showcase section within the card workspace at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2] — do not alter other parts of the Logo Concept Generator or any other tool
Use only basic SVG primitives (rect, circle, polygon, text, line, linearGradient, clipPath) — no heavy external libraries or complex path calculations
Do not modify immutable frontend paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui
nonGoals: Changing the logo concept text description section above the visual output
Modifying any other tools (Brand Name Generator, Marketing Content, Sentiment Analyzer, Color Palette, Chatbot)
Adding new backend endpoints or changing backend logic
Adding AI-generated raster images or external image assets for logos
Changing the overall app layout, sidebar, or navigation
